snippet.textDisplay:
SotC has a WAY better camera than Mario 64. I'm pretty sure that Mario 64 was the first game to have an adjustable camera so it makes sense that it would seem dated.
Most dual-analog platformers have near perfect camera, like Sly Cooper.
snippet.textOriginal:
SotC has a WAY better camera than Mario 64. I'm pretty sure that Mario 64 was the first game to have an adjustable camera so it makes sense that it would seem dated.
Most dual-analog platformers have near perfect camera, like Sly Cooper.

snippet.textDisplay:
I honestly don't remember SM64's camera being that bad.  It and SOTC should not be bashed for their camera issues so much - I can probably count the number of times the camera went silly in both games on my last playthroughs of each on one hand.

To be fair, I've come to accept that fighting the camera is an integral part of 3D platformers...
snippet.textOriginal:
I honestly don't remember SM64's camera being that bad.  It and SOTC should not be bashed for their camera issues so much - I can probably count the number of times the camera went silly in both games on my last playthroughs of each on one hand.

To be fair, I've come to accept that fighting the camera is an integral part of 3D platformers...

snippet.textDisplay:
I remember getting to the last Bowser boss in Super Mario 64 when I was a kid. The organs and overall atmosphere of the battle let me know that shit was going down, it was so awesome. There was such a buildup to the fight, and I'd been playing for months so finally making it that far was a milestone. 

SO LONG-SE BOWSER!
snippet.textOriginal:
I remember getting to the last Bowser boss in Super Mario 64 when I was a kid. The organs and overall atmosphere of the battle let me know that shit was going down, it was so awesome. There was such a buildup to the fight, and I'd been playing for months so finally making it that far was a milestone. 

SO LONG-SE BOWSER!

snippet.textDisplay:
@OutlawCatx Yes, that IS Nintendo's demographic, and they should stick to it. The only downside is that when their fans get older, they tend to want more hardcore stuff from Nintendo, but the cold truth is that they've moved on to the next generation of kids.

Still, if the rumors are true, Nintendo's next console will appeal to kids and hardcore fans.
snippet.textOriginal:
@OutlawCatx Yes, that IS Nintendo's demographic, and they should stick to it. The only downside is that when their fans get older, they tend to want more hardcore stuff from Nintendo, but the cold truth is that they've moved on to the next generation of kids.

Still, if the rumors are true, Nintendo's next console will appeal to kids and hardcore fans.

snippet.textDisplay: Screw Dead Space, Resident Evil, Silent Hill, Fatal Frame, all of them. Scariest video game moment ever will always belong to those damn endless stairs going up endlessly for 15 minutes, turning around to see you haven't moved one inch. THAT'S damn scary. Scarier than something popping out and screaming for two seconds.
snippet.textOriginal: Screw Dead Space, Resident Evil, Silent Hill, Fatal Frame, all of them. Scariest video game moment ever will always belong to those damn endless stairs going up endlessly for 15 minutes, turning around to see you haven't moved one inch. THAT'S damn scary. Scarier than something popping out and screaming for two seconds.

snippet.textDisplay: @futbolmario13 Super Mario Galaxy 1's Daredevil Comet fight with Bouldergeist will be horrifyingly carved into my skull forever. THAT was tougher than anything I faced in Super Mario 64-which is still my favorite game of all time, though.
snippet.textOriginal: @futbolmario13 Super Mario Galaxy 1's Daredevil Comet fight with Bouldergeist will be horrifyingly carved into my skull forever. THAT was tougher than anything I faced in Super Mario 64-which is still my favorite game of all time, though.

snippet.textDisplay: After defeating Bowser two times before the final battle, I wasn't really expecting any difference in the music and the way the battle plays through. Needless to say, Koji Kondo only needed a pipe organ to completely blow away what was my perception of a final boss in a game.
snippet.textOriginal: After defeating Bowser two times before the final battle, I wasn't really expecting any difference in the music and the way the battle plays through. Needless to say, Koji Kondo only needed a pipe organ to completely blow away what was my perception of a final boss in a game.
